general_advisory: Rainfall followed by clear sky, dry weather favors sucking pests like aphids, Jassids, thrips, and whiteflies. To manage these pests at an early stage of infestation, spray neem-based pesticide (Neem Oil) 1500 PPM @600-ml/acre by mixing it in 200-litre of water. To manage these sucking pests chemically, spray Thiamethoxam 25% WG) @ 40-gram/acre or Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 50-gram/acre or Tolfenpyrad 15% EC @ 400-ml/acre by mixing it in 200-liter of water.

advisory: As the weather is expected to be clear, harvesting of matured rice can be done. Sundry for 2-3 days to reduce the moisture content to 14%.

To manage whitefly infestation at the early stage of the crop, spray neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water. If the infestation is severe then go for chemical pesticide like Thiamethoxam @ 40-gram/acre or Acetamiprid @ 50-gram/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.
Spotted pod borer observed in some places in Arhar. To control, use bird perches @50/hectare, use Azadirachtin 0.03% WSP or use NSKE 5% or neem oil 2%.

Animals should be given a mineral mixture along with salt regularly and wheat grains, jaggery, etc. may be provided @ 10%-20% in the daily ration during the winter season to meet the energy requirement of the animals.
Keep the shed warm as the night temperature is getting down. Provide a bulb to heat the room.
